Nerangs.ab: aētaṯ dim vīspanąm daste-ye hāvan az ruy-e sang-e urvis be-dast gereftan mazištəm dazdiiāi ahūmca ratūmca yim ahurəm mazdąm čašm va ruy andar vāḫtar afšānidan snaϑāi aŋhrahe mainiiə̄uš druuatō yaʾni zanešn b-ahreman druvand snaθāi aešmahe xruuī.draōš čašm va ruy andar avāḫtar afšānidan yaʾni zaneš be-hišm ḫore-ye vepadraḫš (***?) div dādam snaθāi mazaniianąm daēuuanąm čašm va ruy andar avāḫtar afšānidan yaʾni zaneš be māzanigān divān dādam snaθāi vīspanąm daēuuanąm čašm va ruy andar avāḫtar afšānidan yaʾni zanešn bā hamān divān dādam varənīnąmca druuatąm daste az ruy-e sang-urvis bar dāštan se bār bar se sān hāvan zadan yekbār az ānsu ke xoršid bar-āyad yeki az ānsuy-e nimruz yeki az ānsuy ke xoršid foru šavad pas daste bar dast negāh dāštan

"(He should recite) aētaṯ dim vīspanąm, take in the hand the pestle of the hāvan from the urvis-stone (and continue with) mazištəm dazdiiāi ahūmca ratūmca yim ahurəm mazdąm. He should turn his glance and face towards the East (and recite) snaϑāi aŋhrahe mainiiə̄uš druuatō that means, the striking of the druvand Ahreman. At snaθāi aešmahe xruuī.draōš he should turn his glance and face to the North that means, I stroke the div Hišm with bloody mace. At snaθāi mazaniianąm daēuuanąm he should (again) turn his glance and face to the North that means, I stroke the divs māzanigān. At snaθāi vīspanąm daēuuanąm he should turn his glance and face to the North that means, I stroke all divs. At varənīnąmca druuatąm he should take the pestle from the urvis-stone and hit the hāvan three times and at three sides: once at the side in which the sun goes up, once from the south side and once at the side in which the sun goes down. Then he should keep the pestle in his hand."
